column2: Mysuru and thereafter the marriage was performed before the elders on 20.09.2010. It is alleged in the complaint that the complainant was tortured physically and mentally in demand of money by the accused No.1 to 4.

column1: The accused demanded for money to open a shop and a Gym center. Even after compliance of the dowwry the accused harassed the complainant. The accused demanded for Zen Car. The accused also caused harassment to the complainant in her work place. The evidence of PW.1 is totally contrary to the complaint. PW.1 has not deposed in accordance with the contents of the complaint. When the complainant turned hostile and not supported the case of the prosecution she was cross examined by the learned APP.
10. The PW.1 has admitted during the cross examination about the compromise held in between the complainant and the accused.
11. PW.2 Sri. Girigowda is the father of the complainant who turned hostile and not supported the case of the prosecution.
11. PW.3 Smt. Pramila is the mother of the complainant who turned hostile and not supported the case of the prosecution.
12. The learned APP prayed to issue summons to the other witnesses
column2: but no purpose will be served in examining the other witnesses in view of the oral evidence given by the complainant before the Court of law. Hence
column3: the prayer of learned APP was rejected and the case of the prosecution was closed."	ANALYSIS	"The contents of the complaint are that the complainant and the accused No.1 married on DATE before the Sub-Registrar
column4: Mysuru and thereafter the marriage was performed before the elders on 20.09.2010. It is alleged in the complaint that the complainant was tortured physically and mentally in demand of money by the accused No.1 to 4.

column1: The accused demanded for money to open a shop and a Gym center. Even after compliance of the dowwry the accused harassed the complainant. The accused demanded for Zen Car. The accused also caused harassment to the complainant in her work place. The evidence of PW.1 is totally contrary to the complaint. 10. The PW.1 has admitted during the cross examination about the compromise held in between the complainant and the accused.

column1: 11. The law can be summarised in the following terms: 1. The circumstances relied upon by the prosecution which lead to an inference to the guilt of the accused must be proved beyond doubt; 2. The circumstances should unerringly point towards the guilt of the accused; 3. The circumstances should be linked together in such a manner that the cumulative effect of the chain formed by joining the links is so complete that it leads to only one conclusion i.e. the guilt of the accused; 4. That there should be no probability of the crime having been committed by a person other than the accused."	ANALYSIS	"

11. The law can be summarised in the following terms: 1. The circumstances relied upon by the prosecution which lead to an inference to the guilt of the accused must be proved beyond doubt; 2. The circumstances should unerringly point towards the guilt of the accused; 3. The circumstances should be linked together in such a manner that the cumulative effect of the chain formed by joining the links is so complete that it leads to only one conclusion i.e. the guilt of the accused; 4. That there should be no probability of the crime having been committed by a person other than the accused."

ACT:
Criminal Breach of Trust--Ingredients of--Common intention--
Meaning of--Indian Penal Code (XLV of 1860)
HEADNOTE:
The first appellant was the Managing Director and the second
appellant a Director and technical expert of a cloth dyeing
concern known as Parikh Dyeing and Printing Mills Ltd."
company entered into a contract with the Textile
Commissioner undertaking to dye a large quantity of cloth
which was supplied to the company for that purpose."	PREAMBLE	"The
company entered into a contract with the Textile
Commissioner undertaking to dye a large quantity of cloth
which was supplied to the company for that purpose."
pursuance of the contract certain quantity of cloth was dyed
and delivered to the Textile Commissioner by the company but
it failed to dye and deliver the balance of cloth which
remained in its possession and was not returned to the
Textile Commissioner in spite of repeated demands."	PREAMBLE	"In
pursuance of the contract certain quantity of cloth was dyed
and delivered to the Textile Commissioner by the company but
it failed to dye and deliver the balance of cloth which
remained in its possession and was not returned to the
Textile Commissioner in spite of repeated demands."
Ultimately the two appellants were prosecuted for criminal
breach of trust under S. 409 read with S. 34 of the Indian
Penal Code and were convicted for the same in a trial by
jury."	PREAMBLE	"
Ultimately the two appellants were prosecuted for criminal
breach of trust under PROVISION read with S. 34 of the Indian
Penal Code and were convicted for the same in a trial by
jury."

column2: but does not include a mortgage hypothecation
column3: charge or pledge"".

column5: at the time of their appropriation to the contract of sale or purchase by the seller or by the purchaser
column6: whether the assent of the other party is prior or subsequent to such appropriation""."	STA	"

column4: threat or promise proceeding from a person in authority; (v) such inducement
column5: threat or promise

column8: which would appear to him reasonable
column9: for supposing that by making it he would gain any advantage or avoid any evil of a temporal nature in reference to the proceedings against him."	ANALYSIS	"
